info.title: Strimzi HTTP Bridge for Apache Kafka
info.description: The Strimzi HTTP Bridge for Apache Kafka provides a REST API for integrating HTTP based client applications with a Kafka cluster. You can use the API to create and manage consumers and send and receive records over HTTP rather than the native Kafka protocol.

post.description: Creates a consumer instance in the given consumer group. You can optionally specify a consumer name and supported configuration options. It returns a base URI used to construct URIs for subsequent requests against this consumer instance.

requestBody.description: Name and configuration of the consumer. The name is unique within the scope of the consumer group. If a name is not specified, a randomly generated name is assigned. All parameters are optional. The supported configuration options are shown in the following example.

409.description: A consumer instance with the specified name already exists in the Kafka Bridge.

value.message: A consumer instance with the specified name already exists in the Kafka Bridge.

422.description: One or more consumer configuration options have invalid values.

value.message: One or more consumer configuration options have invalid values.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group in which to create the consumer.

post.description: Configures a subscribed consumer to seek (and subsequently read from) the first offset in one or more given topic partitions.

requestBody.description: List of topic partitions to which the consumer is subscribed. The consumer will seek the first offset in the specified partitions.

204.description: Seek to the beginning performed successfully.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group to which the subscribed consumer belongs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the subscribed consumer.

post.description: Configures a subscribed consumer to seek (and subsequently read from) the offset at the end of one or more of the given topic partitions.

requestBody.description: List of topic partitions to which the consumer is subscribed. The consumer will seek the last offset in the specified partitions.

204.description: Seek to the end performed successfully.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group to which the subscribed consumer belongs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the subscribed consumer.

post.description: Subscribes a consumer to one or more topics. You can describe the topics to which the consumer will subscribe in a list (of `Topics` type) or as a `topic_pattern` field. Each call replaces the subscriptions for the subscriber.

requestBody.description: List of topics to which the consumer will subscribe.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

409.description: Subscriptions to topics, partitions, and patterns are mutually exclusive.

value.message: Subscriptions to topics, partitions, and patterns are mutually exclusive.

delete.description: Unsubscribes a consumer from all topics.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group to which the subscribed consumer belongs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the consumer that you want to unsubscribe from topics.

post.description: Configures a subscribed consumer to fetch offsets from a particular offset the next time it fetches a set of records from a given topic partition. This overrides the default fetch behavior for consumers. You can specify one or more topic partitions.

requestBody.description: List of partition offsets from which the subscribed consumer will next fetch records.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group to which the consumer belongs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the subscribed consumer.

post.description: Assigns one or more topic partitions to a consumer.

requestBody.description: List of topic partitions to assign to the consumer.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

409.description: Subscriptions to topics, partitions, and patterns are mutually exclusive.

value.message: Subscriptions to topics, partitions, and patterns are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group to which the consumer belongs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the consumer to which you want to assign topic partitions.

post.description: Sends one or more records to a given topic, optionally specifying a partition, key, or both.

404.description: The specified topic was not found.

value.message: The specified topic was not found.

422.description: The record list is not valid.

value.message: The record list contains invalid records.

parameters.name: topicname
parameters.description: Name of the topic to which you want to send records.

get.description: Retrieves records for a subscribed consumer, including message values, topics, and partitions. The operation MUST be routed through the base URI of the consumer to the Kafka Bridge instance that contains the consumer.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

406.description: The `format` used in the consumer creation request does not match the embedded format in the Accept header of this request.

value.message: The `format` used in the consumer creation request does not match the embedded format in the Accept header of this request.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group to which the subscribed consumer belongs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the subscribed consumer for which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, that the HTTP Bridge spends retrieving records before timing out the request.

parameters.name: max_bytes
parameters.description: The maximum size, in bytes, of unencoded keys and values that can be included in the response. Otherwise, an error response with code 422 is returned.

post.description: Sends one or more records to a given topic partition, optionally specifying a key.

requestBody.description: List of records to send to a given topic partition, including a value (required) and a key (optional).

404.description: The specified topic partition was not found.

value.message: The specified topic partition was not found.

parameters.name: topicname
parameters.description: Name of the topic containing the partition to which you want to send records.

parameters.name: partitionid
parameters.description: ID of the partition to which you want to send records.

delete.description: Deletes a specified consumer instance. The operation MUST be routed through the base URI of the consumer to the Kafka Bridge instance that contains the consumer.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group to which the consumer belongs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the consumer that you want to delete.

post.description: Commits a list of consumer offsets. To commit offsets for all records fetched by the consumer, leave the request body empty.

requestBody.description: List of consumer offsets to commit to the consumer offsets commit log. You can specify one or more topic partitions to commit offsets for.

404.description: The specified consumer instance was not found.

value.message: The specified consumer instance was not found.

parameters.name: groupid
parameters.description: ID of the consumer group to which the consumer belongs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the consumer.

name.description: The unique name for the consumer instance. The name is unique within the scope of the consumer group. The name is used in URLs.

format.description: The allowable message format for the consumer, which can be `binary` (default) or `json`. The messages are converted into a JSON format.

auto.offset.reset.description:
Resets the offset position for the consumer. 
If set to `earliest`, messages are read from the first offset. 
If set to `latest`, messages are read from the latest offset.

auto.commit.enable.description: If set to `true`, message offsets are committed automatically for the consumer. If set to `false`, message offsets must be committed manually.

fetch.min.bytes.description: Sets the minimum ammount of data, in bytes, for the consumer to receive. The broker waits until the data to send exceeds this amount.

consumer.request.timeout.ms.description: Sets the maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, for the consumer to wait for messages for a request. If the timeout period is reached without a response, an error is returned.

instance_id.description: Unique ID for the consumer instance in the group.

base_uri.description: Base URI used to construct URIs for subsequent requests against this consumer instance.

tags.name: Consumers
tags.description: Consumer operations to create consumers in your Kafka cluster and perform common actions, such as subscribing to topics, retrieving processed records, and committing offsets.

tags.name: Topics
tags.description: Topic operations to send messages to a specified topic or topic partition. You can include message keys in requests.

tags.name: Seek
tags.description: Seek operations that enable a consumer to begin receiving messages from a given offset position.

tags.name: Producer
tags.description: Producer operations to send records to a specified topic or topic partition.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about the Strimzi HTTP Bridge
